title: How to Find Anyone’s Comments on Facebook by Keyword or Post

steps.title: Open Facebook.
steps.content: Open Facebook. You can either open the Facebook app on your mobile device or sign in to www.facebook.com on a desktop computer.

steps.title: Go to your profile page.
steps.content: Go to your profile page. To do so on mobile, tap the menu icon which resembles your profile picture in the top right corner (Android), or the icon with three lines in the bottom-right corner (iPhone). Then tap your name at the top of the menu. On a desktop computer, click your name at the top of the menu panel to the left.

steps.title: Click or tap the icon with three dots ••• .
steps.content: Click or tap the icon with three dots ••• . It’s to the right of the menu bar at the top of your profile page. This displays a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click or tap Search.
steps.content: Click or tap Search . It’s next to an icon that resembles a magnifying glass.

steps.title: Enter your friend’s name in the search bar.
steps.content: Enter your friend’s name in the search bar. Be sure to enter their first and last name. This will display posts your friend has commented on, as well as posts your friend has left on your wall.

steps.title: Filter your search.
steps.content: Filter your search. You can use the options at the top of the page (or in the Filters menu on mobile), or in the menu bar to the left on a desktop computer to filter your search. The options are as follows: Posts you’ve seen : Click this option to limit your search to posts you’ve already seen. Most recent: Click this option to sort your search results by the most recent posts first. Tagged location: This allows you to search by a location if your friend tagged you at a specific location. Date posted: This displays a drop-down menu of years. You can click on which year the comment was made to filter results by year.

steps.title: Find the comment on a post.
steps.content: Find the comment on a post. When you see the post you are looking for, click or tap Comment below the post. If the comment is on a reel, click or tap the icon that resembles a speech bubble on the right side of the video playback. This displays the comment thread for the post.

steps.title: Open Facebook.
steps.content: Open Facebook. You can either open the Facebook app on your mobile device or sign in to www.facebook.com on a desktop computer.

steps.title: Go to the profile or page your friend left a comment on.
steps.content: Go to the profile or page your friend left a comment on. This may be your friend’s personal profile or a mutual friend’s profile that they commented on. It can also be a group or a page you both belong to or follow. To go to the profile or page, tap the magnifying glass icon at the top of the page and enter the person’s name or the name of the page or group the comment was left on. On a desktop computer, use the search bar at the top of the menu to the left. Then click or tap the person’s profile, page, or group the comment was left on. https://www.facebook.com/help/android-app/210842332283728 To search someone else’s profile, they must have their profile set to public, or they must be added as a friend. If you are searching within a group, the group must be public or it must be a group you both belong to.

steps.title: Click or tap the icon with three dots ••• .
steps.content: Click or tap the icon with three dots ••• . It’s to the far right in the menu bar at the top of the page. This displays a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click or tap Search.
steps.content: Click or tap Search . It’s next to an icon that resembles a magnifying glass. This displays a search bar that allows you to search within the person’s profile.

steps.title: Enter a search term for the comment you are looking for.
steps.content: Enter a search term for the comment you are looking for. If you are searching for a comment a friend posted, you can enter that friend’s first and last name. Alternatively, you can search for a word or phrase contained within the comment or post.

steps.title: Filter your search.
steps.content: Filter your search. You can use the options at the top of the page (or in the Filters menu) on mobile, or in the menu bar to the left on a desktop computer to filter your search. The options are as follows: Posts you’ve seen : Click this option to limit your search to posts you’ve already seen. Most recent: Click this option to sort your search results by the most recent posts first. Tagged location: This allows you to search by a location if your friend tagged you at a specific location. Date posted: This displays a drop-down menu of years. You can click on which year the comment was made to filter results by year.

steps.title: Find the comment on a post.
steps.content: Find the comment on a post. When you see the post you are looking for, click or tap Comment below the post. If the comment is on a reel, click or tap the icon that resembles a speech bubble on the right side of the video playback. This displays the comment thread for the post.

steps.title: Sign in to www.facebook.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Sign in to www.facebook.com in a web browser. If you're looking for a certain friend's comment on a specific photo or post, start by logging in to your Facebook account. This method won't work in the Facebook mobile app, but you can log in to Facebook using your phone or tablet's web browser.

steps.title: Locate the post with the comment you want to find.
steps.content: Locate the post with the comment you want to find. It may be on your profile or theirs or a different page entirely.

steps.title: View all comments on the post.
steps.content: View all comments on the post. Click Comments below the post. If you see "Most Relevant" above the comment list, click it and select All Comments instead. If you still see a View previous comments link above the top post, it means you'll need to click it again to reveal more comments. You may have to click this button over and over again until all comments are displayed.

steps.title: Expand all replies.
steps.content: Expand all replies. To expand all replies under a comment, click View all # replies below the comment.Then click View all # replies below any of the expanded replies. “#” is the number of replies to a thread. You’ll need to expand all replies to the thread.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+F (PC) or ⌘ Cmd+F (Mac) to open the Find window.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + F (PC) or ⌘ Cmd + F (Mac) to open the Find window. This opens a small window that allows you to search for specific text on the page. If you're using a phone or tablet, you'll have to open your browser's Find feature: Safari : Swipe down slightly to show the option bar at the bottom, and then tap the Share icon (a square with an up-pointing arrow). Swipe left across the bottom row of icons and tap Find on Page . Chrome : Tap the three-dot menu and select Find in Page…

steps.title: Type your friend's first and last name.
steps.content: Type your friend's first and last name. This type of search will only show you exact matches, so be sure to type several consecutive letters. You’ll need to use their first and last name. Alternatively, you can use words or phrases within the comment..

steps.title: Use the arrows on the Find window to scroll through the results.
steps.content: Use the arrows on the Find window to scroll through the results. Clicking the down-arrow on the Find window brings you to the first instance of your friend's name on the page. Clicking the down-arrow again will bring you to another instance of that name. Continue until you find the comment you are searching for.
